com.mattrader.common

Class HistoricalTableCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mattrader.common.HistoricalTableCom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class HistoricalTableCom
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventManagerCom.DirectaConnectorListener
    This class is an higher level class, it is a wrapper for a candle, it provide methods for easier query of data and a different way of representing them. It is built having in mind the way Yahoo! Finance shows historical data (example).

    Notes:

    - Data are sorted in ascending temporal order
    - If data are requested while the market, in which the ticker lives, is open, then those data will contains in the last raw information relative the current date; so the last raw may be inconsistent because contains live informations.

      • table

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<?>> table()
        Returns:
        the table containing all the data or null if the table is not ready. Data are sorted in temporal ascending order. Columns are:

        - Date;
        - Open;
        - High;
        - Low;
        - Close;
        - Volume;

        The last row contains data of the current date. If it is open, data represented may be inconsistent

      • onReadyEventManager

        public EventManagerCom onReadyEventManager()
        This method returns an EventManagerCom that will collect EventCom.TableReadyEvent and trigger callback
        Returns:
        the EventManagerCom specific for EventCom.TableReadyEvent
        See Also:
        EventManagerCom

      • notifyReady

        void notifyReady()
        This method collect the notification that specify the table is ready. This will fire a EventCom.TableReadyEvent
